meanings.definition: To eat up greedily or ravenously.
meanings.sent1: The hungry child was devouring the delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The lion was devouring its prey in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was devouring its food so fast, it seemed like a race.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be devouring the memories of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The flames were devouring everything in their path, leaving only ashes behind.

meanings.sent1: The devouring flames quickly spread through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The devouring hunger in his eyes showed his desperation for food.
meanings.sent3: The devouring speed of the car made her hold onto her seat tightly.
meanings.sent4: The devouring curiosity of the cat led it to explore every corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The devouring waves crashed against the shore, eroding the sandcastle slowly.

meanings.sent1: The darkness of the night was devouring the city, hiding all its lights.
meanings.sent2: The devouring sadness in her heart made it hard to smile.
meanings.sent3: The devouring silence in the room made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent4: The devouring fog enveloped the entire valley, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent5: The devouring power of the storm left destruction in its wake.
